intro: Pterocarya stenoptera var. typica, commonly known as the Chinese wingnut, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Juglandaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The tree produces distinctive winged nuts enclosed in a fleshy, hairy husk. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
